title: Jacinda Ardern
summary: Jacinda Kate Laurell Ardern[1] (/dʒəˈsɪndə ɑːrˈdɜːrn/ jə-SIN-də ar-DURN;[2] born 26 July 1980) is a New Zealand politician who has been the 40th prime minister of New Zealand and  leader of the Labour Party since 2017. She was first elected to the House of Representatives as a list MP in 2008, and has been the member of Parliament (MP) for Mount Albert since March 2017.[3]
